main.name: Ahmer Muhammad Farooq
main.description: Fresh out of university with a a quality blend of academic achievement, industry experience, and side projects. Seeking out challenging, exciting, and impactful roles in the software industry where I can fully apply my abilities.
main.bio: I am a recent graduate with a degree in Computer Science at the University of Toronto. Most recently, I have worked as both a DevOps engineer and Applications Developer through internships and am currently seeking new full time opportunites to finally apply averything I have learned.
main.contactmessage: Please feel free to reach out to me by email, call, or text.

resume.skillmessage: I am proud to say I have built a plethora of skills throughout my internships, my education and through my own personal learning,

work.title: DevOps Intern
description: Centralized access to automation and team resources through development of resource management system using Ruby, Java, and MySQL
Automated common administrative tasks through the JIRA and Confluence APIâ€™s using a Nodejs based Slack Bot built on Docker
Administered standard DevOps tools such TeamCity, Sensu, Chef, and the ELK stack to build robust CI/CD pipelines
Monitored and maintained 300+ Windows Server 2008/2016 and OEL 7 virtual machines through OVMM and MS Hyper-V
Increased visibility in TeamCity build failures through creation of ELK pipelines through leveraging the TeamCity API

work.title: Applications Development and Services
description: Designed a full Proof-of-Concept for integrating the SonarQube tool for code quality analysis into existing deployment pipeline
Developed a Java Application which automated the creation of dashboards illustrating the code quality of the engineering team
Presented key code quality metrics to directors and managers, convincing the team to invest in a code analysis tool

projects.title: TweetShow
projects.category: An in-depth twitter sentiment, emotion, and difficulty analysis tool

projects.title: PlanitApp
projects.category: An app created for my Software Engineering course, not my original idea. Allows users to plan trips using their location, budget, and personal preferances.

projects.title: Simple Cricket Score Tracker
projects.category: Built and deployed a mobile application on the Google Play Store which allows users to keep track of cricket scores including runs, wickets, overs, No Balls, Wide Balls, etc.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
